He means one coagulated group of English as a first language speakers and English speaking lands.  EU East is dominated by Germans and Austrians, all of which may not even have English as a third language (my three German and Russian friends had it as the fourth and fifth languages).  EU West is at least centered around the Western/Central European nations of UK, France, Spain, etc, wherein most of them speak English (or at least read it) as the first or second language because of the US and UK.

The only server split that might be argued would be one for Hispanic speakers, which dun dun dun, there is already a server for that.  If all Chicagoans and Yankees spoke Persian as their first language, and English their second or third, then there would be compelling arguments to have a separate East Coast server.

I don't think you are quite right about the EU there....

Germany ist considered part of Central EU, not East. Even Riot thinks so, which is why German players are on EUW servers. It's new to me that Germans and Austrians dominate anything but their respective countries.
After WW2 Germans were actually expulsed from the entire East - you can read up on it [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_and_expulsion_of_Germans_%281944%E2%80%9350%29).

I don't know where your German friends are coming from, but at my school you had to take English as first or second additional language and you had to keep it until you were finished with school. It's possible that your friends are much older than I am, and lived for example before the Fall of the Wall in East - Germany. They would not have learned any English there and I guess it would be similar for Russians who grew up/lived during the height of the Cold War.
Anyways. Modern Education in Germany "forces" you to learn English very soon, no matter what school you're visiting.

I don't know anything about French and Spanish education, but I can tell you that there is a well-known prejudice among european players, that French people generally refuse to communicate in any language other than their own.

But let's be honest. These days you simply have to understand English to do anything at all. Only a fraction of the whole media - movies, books, you name it - is ever translated (and half of those translations are atrocious). To play League of Legends you have to speak English, because even when talking in German we still call this {{item:3153}}  Blade of the ruined King, and not _Klinge des ruinierten KÃ¶nigs_.

I agree with the sentiment of fucking riot.

Riot is just stupid.  Why would you change server locations?  If this had move never existed, people would still play league on both sides of the coast.  Sure, east coast would have higher ping but they've been playing like that for 4 years.  Riot is just stirring up the hornet's nest for seemingly no good reason.  Everyone was happy before the news about the server move, sure some East coast 14 year olds were bitching about ping and whatnot but they still played.  Unless Riot makes a significantly higher money from East Coast, I don't see why you would move the server to Chicago.  To fix that problem, I would just make 2 new servers, and people from different coasts and play on whichever server they want with their friends.  So if they want to play together, one guy can get the higher ping, but most cases people who duo queue will likely be physically in proximity in each other.   (same side of the coast)
